main_definition: A PhD, or Doctor of Philosophy, is the highest academic degree awarded by universities in many countries to individuals who have completed advanced research studies and made a significant contribution to their field through original scholarly work.

meanings_and_examples.example: John earned his PhD from Oxford University after five years of rigorous study.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Academic degree requiring original research or dissertation
meanings_and_examples.example: Sarah's PhD thesis was on the impact of climate change on marine biodiversity, which she defended successfully in front of a panel of experts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Doctoral level degree typically obtained by individuals pursuing advanced careers in academia or research
meanings_and_examples.example: As an accomplished professor with multiple publications and awards, Dr. Smith holds a PhD in Chemistry.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A title used to address someone who has earned a Doctoral degree without specifying the field of study
meanings_and_examples.example: When introducing Professor Anderson at a conference, they referred to him as 'Dr.' followed by his last name.
